abstract: After 10 years of aspiration, three years of negotiation and almost a year of litigation, an agreement is reached on how and where to rebuild St. Nicholas Greek Orthodox Church, which was destroyed on Sept. 11, 2001.
snippet: After 10 years of aspiration, three years of negotiation and almost a year of litigation, an agreement is reached on how and where to rebuild St. Nicholas Greek Orthodox Church, which was destroyed on Sept. 11, 2001.

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Port Authority of New York and New Jersey

lead_paragraph: Even before the fires were extinguished at ground zero, everyone agreed that St. Nicholas Greek Orthodox Church at 155 Cedar Street - crushed by the collapse of 2 World Trade Center - would rise again.

headline.main: Way Is Cleared to Rebuild Greek Orthodox Church Lost on 9/11
